title: River Ericht
text:
The River Ericht () is a river in <a href="Perthshire">Perthshire</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a> formed from the confluence of the rivers Blackwater and Ardle at <a href="Bridge%20of%20Cally">Bridge of Cally</a>.
It runs south for around 10 miles before discharging into the <a href="River%20Isla%2C%20Perthshire">River Isla</a>, and eventually the <a href="River%20Tay">River Tay</a>. The river cuts through the impressive <a href="Craighall%20Gorge">Craighall Gorge</a> before dissecting the burgh of <a href="Blairgowrie%20and%20Rattray">Blairgowrie and Rattray</a>.
The fast running water of the river was once used to power several <a href="textile">textile</a> <a href="Factory">mills</a>. Game <a href="fishing">fishing</a> for <a href="salmon">salmon</a> and <a href="trout">trout</a> is possible on some stretches with an appropriate licence.
